item.description: ğŸš¨ This woman nails it while Legacy media ignores it. â€œDid you guys hear about the illegal immigrant that was arrested in Georgia yesterday for brutally raping an 11-year-old girl at knifepoint and forcing her ten year old little sister to watch after breaking into their bedroom? Hmm, probably not, because you dumbasses have been so stuck on the five year old that was supposedly detained by ICE that with a 30 second Google search, you would have figured out that his dad actually ran and abandoned him and ICE wasn't going to leave a five-year-old by himself. You guys are so clinically stupid it hurts.â€

item.title: @elonmusk: ELON MUSK: MAKE LIFE MULTI-PLANETARY WITH THE KEY THRESHOLD TO SUSTAIN EVEN WITHOUT SUPPLY SHIPS FRO...
item.description: ELON MUSK: MAKE LIFE MULTI-PLANETARY WITH THE KEY THRESHOLD TO SUSTAIN EVEN WITHOUT SUPPLY SHIPS FROM EARTH "The goal is to make life multi-planetary. The key threshold for that is if the supply ships from Earth stop coming for any reason, Mars does not die out That is the critical "Great Filter," if you talk about things in terms of the Fermi Paradox "The Great Filter is Mars being self-sustaining without any supply ships from Earth" Until we reach that point, we are really just a one-planet civilization with an extension. If Mars becomes self-sustaining, then even in a worst-case scenario of Earthâ€™s civilization either dying with a bang or a whimper Mars would have a much better chance of surviving So, the intent here overall is to ensure that the light of consciousness, which appears to be just a tiny candle in a vast darkness"

item.title: @elonmusk: WHY WE SHOULD GO TO MARS: ELON MUSK ON SECURING THE FUTURE OF CONSCIOUSNESS Going to Mars isnâ€™t abou...
item.description: WHY WE SHOULD GO TO MARS: ELON MUSK ON SECURING THE FUTURE OF CONSCIOUSNESS Going to Mars isnâ€™t about escapeâ€”itâ€™s about insurance. Itâ€™s about making sure the light of consciousness doesnâ€™t go out if something catastrophic happens on Earth. Elon has consistently framed the Mars mission as the single most important step humanity can take to ensure long-term survival and expansion. â€œThe key branching point for human destiny or destiny of consciousness as a whole is that Mars is self-sustaining, even if the resupply ships from Earth stop coming. Youâ€™re not multiplanetary until the planet can grow by itself. Because thereâ€™s always some risk of technology on Earth falling below a certain level or of a nuclear war or a meteor. You havenâ€™t secured the future of civilization and consciousness until both planets can survive independently.â€ This is why Mars matters: â€¢ Backup for humanity â€” A second home protects against single-point failures (asteroids, supervolcanoes, pandemics, nuclear conflict, AI misalignment, etc.). â€¢ Self-sustaining civilization â€” Once Mars can grow its own population and industry without constant Earth resupply, consciousness becomes multiplanetary and far more resilient. â€¢ Inspiration & progress driver â€” The challenge forces breakthroughs in energy, life support, materials, AI, and closed-loop systems that benefit Earth too. â€¢ Long-term species survival â€” Staying on one fragile planet forever is a gamble with extinction-level risks. Mars turns that into a hedge. Every Starship launch, every refueling test, every iteration brings us closer to that branching point. Itâ€™s not luxuryâ€”itâ€™s the ultimate act of responsibility toward future generations.
